text.text: Chapter 3: Identify Hazards and Equity Issues

Identifying the hazards, disasters, and threats (HDT) your community currently faces or might face in the future is the starting point for a realistic discussion about what your vulnerabilities are and how you can be more resilient. Understanding who is most impacted by those HDT, and how and why, is the foundation for improving equity.
In this chapter you can select activities that will help you:
- Explore data and information on hazards, disasters, and threats your community faces
- Gather data on equity
- Engage community members to understand their experiences with HDT
- Identify who in your community is most impacted by HDT and how, and discuss the root causes of these impacts and existing inequities
As you do the activities, use the
Summary of Hazards, Disasters, Threats and Equity Issues form
on the next page to record what you learn about HDT and equity in your community. You can use this to help you do the activities in Chapters 4 and 5.
Getting community participation in these activities can be done in a variety of ways, such as through workshops or one-on-one enagement.
- See
Chapter 1
for examples of ERB projects with selected chapters and activities
- Open the
Example ERB workshop agenda and facilitators guide
and
Example ERB workshop logistics plan
and customize them for planning your workshops.
Chapter 3 Outputs:
- Summary of existing data on HDT
- Summary of existing data on equity
- Storytelling notes
- Hazards and asset maps
- Social vulnerability assessment
- List of top current and future hazards, disasters, and threats.
